alert.note: Alert for Bryce Canyon Country; South Central Utah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 6:59PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield County through 745 PM MDT... At 658 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Bryce Canyon National Park, or 31 miles west of Escalante, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryce Canyon National Park, Tropic and Rubys Inn. This includes Utah Route 12 between mile markers 9 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
